Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole pitched seven innings, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run.
Clay Holmes tossed a perfect eighth inning and Luke Weaver breezed through the ninth, extending the scoreless streak by Yankees relievers to 15 2/3 innings this postseason.
Juan Soto, Gleyber Torres, and Giancarlo Stanton drove in runs for the Yankees.
Gleyber Torres hit a double on the first pitch of the game.
Juan Soto followed with an RBI single on the third pitch of the night.
Giancarlo Stanton extended the lead to 3-0 with his single in the sixth inning.
A near-fracas occurred when Anthony Volpe slapped a hard tag on Maikel Garcia at second base, leading to players spilling out of both dugouts.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone expressed pride in his team, saying, 'We get to go play for it now and we’re excited about that.'

Aaron Judge reflected on the team's journey, saying, 'In 2023, our season ended here, you know? We didn’t get in the postseason. I remember a lot of these guys were looking out on the field, and you know, we all kind of came together and said, ‘It’s not going to happen again.’'

Royals manager Matt Quatraro expressed his feelings for his team, saying, 'Feel really badly for those guys in the room because as you know, this is seven, eight months of the year that they just pour it all into it, and give every ounce of effort and energy they have.'

Giancarlo Stanton commented on the team's mindset, saying, 'We’re in a good place. That doesn’t mean we’re in a great place. We’re here to win. No one wants to be on the losing side of this. Imagine how Kansas City feels right now. Nobody wants to feel that way. We have an opportunity to keep it rolling, but that is understood reality, that we have to take care of business.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kansas City did not win a home game after September 8, losing nine in a row including the playoffs.
The Royals made their first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series.
